bomberman.core.logic
Class Block

java.lang.Object
  bomberman.core.logic.Block
All Implemented Interfaces:
PhysicsEntity
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrickBlock, FreeBlock, WallBlock
public abstract class Block
extends java.lang.Object
implements PhysicsEntity

The Block class defines an abstract piece of world's ground. In Box2D's world is represented with a static Body.

Author:
Federico Scozzafava

Constructor Detail

Block

public Block(float x,
             float y,
             float width,
             float height,
             boolean nullBody,
             LogicWorld world)
Instantiates a new block.

Parameters:
x - the x position in pixels
y - the y position in pixels
width - the width in pixels
height - the height in pixels
nullBody - indicates if the Block has a physics box2d body. If true the Body is instanced.
world - the LogicWorld

Block

public Block(float x,
             float y,
             float dimension,
             boolean nullBody,
             LogicWorld world)
Instantiates a new block.

Parameters:
x - the x position in pixels
y - the y position in pixels
dimension - the dimension (width and height) in pixels
nullBody - indicates if the Block has a physics box2d body. If true the Body is instanced.
world - the LogicWorld

destroy

public abstract Block destroy()
Destroys the Block. Depending on the block's type, it may return its content, another type of block, or itself.

Returns:
another type of Block or itself.
